frontmatter.title: K-means Clustering
frontmatter.description: One of the most well-known unsupervised learning algorithm.

markdownRemark.html:
1. Introduction

K-means clustering is one of the most well-known clustering algorithms in Unsupervised Learning. When I was new in this field, this is the first algorithm I'd ever learnt.

Unlike Linear Regeression, we don't know the label of each data point in K-means. Instead, this algorithm aims to partition data into clusters so that every data point in the same cluster is similar to each other in some way.

2. Algorithm Analysis

Supposed we have NNN data points X=[x1,x2,...,xn]∈RK\bm{ X = [x_1, x_2, ..., x_n ] \in R^K}X=[x1​,x2​,...,xn​]∈RK with K<N\bm{K<N}K<N, we need to find K\bm KK centers (m1,m2,...,mK\bold{m_1, m_2, ..., m_K}m1​,m2​,...,mK​)

Supposed xi\bm x_ixi​ was assigned to cluster K\bm KK, yi=[yi1,yi2,...,yiK]\bm{y_i = [y_{i1}, y_{i2}, ..., y_{iK}]}yi​=[yi1​,yi2​,...,yiK​] is the label vector of data point xi\bm{x_i}xi​ where yik=1\bm{y_{ik}} = 1yik​=1 and yij=0\bm{y_{ij}} = 0yij​=0 (∀j≠k;1<j,k<K)({\forall j \not = k}; 1 < j,k < K)(∀j=k;1<j,k<K). This is called one-hot encoding.

∑k=1Kyik=1,  yik∈{0,1}(1)\tag{1} \bm{\sum_{k=1}^K y_{ik} = 1,\ \ y_{ik} \isin \text{\textbraceleft}0,1\text{\textbraceright}}k=1∑K​yik​=1,  yik​∈{0,1}(1)

Loss function

∥xi−mk∥22\bm{\text{\textbardbl}x_i -m_k \text{\textbardbl}_{2}^{2}}∥xi​−mk​∥22​ yik∥xi−mk∥22=∑j=1Kyij∥xi−mj∥22\bm{ y_{ik}\text{\textbardbl}x_i -m_k\text{\textbardbl}_{2}^{2} = \sum_{j=1}^K{y}_{ij}\text{\textbardbl}x_i -m_j\text{\textbardbl}_{2}^{2} }yik​∥xi​−mk​∥22​=j=1∑K​yij​∥xi​−mj​∥22​

Hello

J=∑i=1N∑j=1Kyij∥xi−mj∥22\bm {J = \sum_{i=1}^N\sum_{j=1}^K{y}_{ij}\text{\textbardbl}x_i -m_j\text{\textbardbl}_{2}^{2}}J=i=1∑N​j=1∑K​yij​∥xi​−mj​∥22​
